document_data.name: Unger Hilldark
document_data.mainbody:
'''Unger Hilldark''' was a [[duergar]] merchant in the City of Coin, [[Athkatla]] of [[Amn]], in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{quote|''Don't be bothering me, little one. I'm not in a pleasant mood this morn.''|Unger Hilldark}}
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1369}}, the famed Athkatlan sculptor Sir [[Sarles]] of the [[Jysstev Estate]] sought {{SI|200|lb|k|long=yes}} of pure [[illithium]] ore to work on a piece commissioned by the [[Church of Helm]]. The only ore merchant in Athkatla at the time who occasionally had access to the elusive material was [[Jerlia]], who ran her business from the [[Waukeen's Promenade]]. Despite Sir Sarles's demands, Jerlia could only get her hands on up to {{SI|50|lb|k|long=yes}} of illithium ore per season. She also revealed that her source of the substance was a duergar merchant, Unger Hilldark, operating out of the [[Copper Coronet]]. Coincidentally, a serial killer named [[Neb]] stole a huge shipment of illithium from Unger around the same time. [[Gorion's Ward]] involved itself in illithium's retrieval from Neb on Unger's behalf, however, the outcome of the task remained unrecorded.
